addressleaf.section: Coppy of a letter to my L. Treasurer the 8 May 1589

page.lettertext:
Belgia 1589 8 May To my L Treasurer
It may please yo
r
L. so to welcome
M
r
Loozen
and
M
r
Valk
, as they
may
tlye
ceave that yo
r
L. will do yt in regard of my wryting.
For though the self same streame hath caryed them w
th
the rest
in theyr publick consulta
o
ns, yet theyr dealing hath bin ever more
moderate, and in
ticular to me very loving & kynde. I do assure
my self that they ar enjoyned in this voyadge to deale in divers
causes against theyr owne proper judgement
, as yo
r
L shall
ceave by the managing of theyr buisynes. But yet they will not
seeme to disunite them selves, or hazarde the losse of the theyr
lodging in
Holland.
I do not name
Mons
r
Egmond
, though
he beare the fyrst place in commissyon: for that I fynd him
one of the worst affected
sons in this contrey, against the
English nation.
For w
ch
I recommend the oth
r
two to yo
r
L. and take
my humble leave. From
e Hage. May 8 1589
